ATTRIBUTE.VALUE: The system shall enable the ADC1 internal voltage regulator before any conversions are performed
The ADC1 system shall perform self-calibration and verify its completion using `LL_ADC_IsCalibrationOnGoing()` before activation.
The ADC1 activation process shall confirm the ADC is disabled using `LL_ADC_IsEnabled()` before proceeding to enable the ADC.
The ADC1 resolution shall be configurable to 12, 10, 8, or 6 bits based on application requirements.
The system shall configure the ADC1 trigger source to software mode using `LL_ADC_REG_TRIG_SOFTWARE`.
ADC1 data alignment shall be configurable to either right or left using `LL_ADC_DATA_ALIGN_RIGHT` or `LL_ADC_DATA_ALIGN_LEFT`.
During calibration, the ADC1 DMA transfers shall be disabled using `LL_ADC_REG_DMA_TRANSFER_NONE` to prevent data corruption.
The ADC1 shall overwrite existing data in case of overrun, as defined by `LL_ADC_REG_OVR_DATA_OVERWRITTEN`.
The ADC conversion process shall verify the End of Conversion (EOC) flag using `LL_ADC_IsActiveFlag_EOC()` before retrieving data.
The ADC1 clock source shall support configuration to synchronous or asynchronous modes using the `LL_ADC_CLOCK_*` macros.
DMA data transfer for ADC1 shall match the resolution and data alignment settings configured for ADC conversions.
GPIO pins used for ADC input channels shall be initialized in analog mode using `LL_GPIO_MODE_ANALOG`.
The system shall define timeout handling for calibration, activation, and conversion processes using timeout macros such as `ADC_CALIBRATION_TIMEOUT_MS`.
The ADC1 shall support single and continuous conversion modes configured with `LL_ADC_REG_CONV_SINGLE` or `LL_ADC_REG_CONV_CONTINUOUS`.
If ADC calibration fails, the system shall invoke the `Error_Handler()` function to handle the failure.
The ADC DMA transfer mode shall be configurable using macros such as `LL_ADC_REG_DMA_TRANSFER_NONE` or `LL_ADC_REG_DMA_TRANSFER_UNLIMITED`.
The ADC1 deinitialization process shall reset all configurations and states to their default values.
The ADC sequencer length shall be configurable to enable sampling of one or multiple channels.
The ADC interrupt handler shall clear the End of Conversion (EOC) flag after processing using `LL_ADC_ClearFlag_EOC()`.
The ADC1 system shall use an internal reference voltage defined as `VDDA_APPLI`.
ADC sampling times shall be configurable using macros such as `LL_ADC_SAMPLINGTIME_*` to accommodate application-specific requirements.
GPIO pins used for LED indicators shall be configured in output mode using `LL_GPIO_MODE_OUTPUT`.
The ADC sequencer shall assign ranks to input channels based on application requirements using `LL_ADC_REG_SetSequencerRanks()`.
NVIC priority levels for ADC interrupts shall be configured during initialization.
The system shall blink an error indicator LED when ADC activation fails.
User button GPIO pins shall be initialized with pull-up resistors and falling-edge event detection.
The ADC internal regulator stabilization delay shall be calculated using `LL_ADC_DELAY_INTERNAL_REGUL_STAB_US`.
The ADC regular group shall disable discontinuous mode by default using `LL_ADC_REG_SEQ_DISCONT_DISABLE`.
ADC overrun errors shall trigger an interrupt using `LL_ADC_EnableIT_OVR()` to allow error handling.
The ADC regular group trigger source shall default to software mode but allow external trigger configurations if required.
The ADC group regular shall support channel configuration for single or multi-channel sampling.
The system shall reset ADC calibration settings during deinitialization.
ADC interrupts shall be configured for End of Conversion (EOC), overrun, and calibration completion.
The ADC internal clock source shall be configurable between asynchronous and synchronous options.
The ADC system shall support runtime reconfiguration of channels and sampling times without requiring a reset.
The ADC sequencer ranks shall be cleared during deinitialization to avoid undefined states.
The ADC calibration factor shall be recalibrated during reinitialization to ensure accurate conversions.
The ADC DMA settings shall synchronize with ADC resolution to prevent data misalignment during transfers.
ADC oversampling features shall be disabled by default during initialization.
The ADC system shall ensure sequencer ranks are updated when channel configurations are changed during runtime.
